definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Don't interpret it without real understanding when you study a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 学习外国语切莫望文生义。

sentences.english: So, obviously, home in chinese had certain relation with piggery in ancient time.
sentences.chinese: 用拆字先生的办法，望文生义，家最初和猪圈有关。

definition: lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
